data.title: Add `fullscreen` class to body when in full screen
data.body:
Add a `fullscreen` class to body when full screen is triggered, as suggested
by in #1694.

This would allow for specific styles when in full screen mode.

data.title: Move build instructions to wiki?
data.body: Right now the build instructions are in the `docs/build-instructions` directory in the repository. Would it be easier for everyone to contribute if a wiki was created? No pull requests necessary :cloud:

data.title: Unable to build atom on Windows 8.1 pro
data.body:
### System Configuration

**OS:** Windows 8.1 pro
**LANG:** Traditional Chinese
**node version:** node-v0.10.28-x86
**python version:** 2.7.6
### Step to reproduce
1. Follow the tutorials written here
   https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/windows.md
   (But I have MSVC 2010 professional installed)
2. open the git shell by using cmd running under admin
### Log Files

```

data.title: Atom only runs properly from root user on Mint 16
data.body:
Re-built Atom today, and now it will only run properly as the root user. If I run as my user, I get:

![screenshot from 2014-05-09 09 55 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3362733/2929507/2c9da602-d78a-11e3-978a-d551d364dda0.png)

but if I run as root I get:

![screenshot from 2014-05-09 09 55 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3362733/2929510/3422691c-d78a-11e3-8019-e088d687aeb7.png)

Not sure how to diagnose this issue. I don't even know where logs are stored for atom.

data.title: Quoting too much causes syntax highlighting to screw up
data.body:
Consider a series of quoted strings in an array in ruby:

``` ruby
states = ['AL', 'AK', 'AZ', 'AR', 'CO', 'DE', 'FL', 'GA', 'HI', 'ID', 'IL', 'IN', 'IA', 'KS', 'KY', 'LA', 'ME', 'MD', 'MI', 'MN', 'MS', 'MO', 'MT', 'NE', 'NV', 'NH', 'NJ', 'NM', 'NY', 'NC', 'ND', 'OH', 'OK', 'OR', 'RI', 'SC', 'SD', 'TX', 'UT', 'VT', 'VA', 'WA', 'WV', 'WI', 'WY']
```

In atom, if this list stopped at `MI` syntax highlighting would resume as normal. However, it acts as if the rest of the file has a single quote at the top:

![quote-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/49549/2928565/eb0b968c-d77e-11e3-934c-1b7c165ada03.gif)

I'm using the [Tomorrow theme](https://atom.io/themes/tomorrow) but it shows up in others as well. This also happens in python, but the quote limit is one less and only the rest of the line is unquoted. Same with C, although again the quote limit changes. Very odd.

data.title: Cursor disappears after holding Alt key
data.body:
When I hold the Alt key for a second (with the side-effect that the entries in the menu bar are showing up) the cursor disappears. This is really annoying for key-bindings where the alt key is involved.
The cursor appears again after pressing a mouse button.

My ubuntu version is 14.04, atom version is 5b7b350 (built from github master).

data.title: cmd+shift+r ->  symbols-view.js:88
data.body:
executing a cmd+shift+r i get the following error

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getCursorBufferPosition' of undefined /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/symbols-view/lib/symbols-view.js:88

data.title: Forces GPU on OSX for pre-2011 MBP
data.body:
Running Atom on OSX forces the hardware GPU to be enabled, which significantly increases power usage. Should not be necessary for a text editor.

Google Chrome has the same problem, so it is probably related to something in Chromium, but it is still a bug IMO.

data.title: Make block cursor cover character underneath it
data.body:
The block cursor does not completely cover characters that are wider than a non-breaking space (the width is set at one single " "), such as CJK characters.

This change updates the `CursorView` with the character under the cursor whenever it moves (i.e., "`cursor:moved`").

(from atom/vim-mode#187)
-  CJK Character
  -  Before: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2460955/d4844204-af71-11e3-9a48-da85b2474e39.png)
  -  After: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2460996/390aa7fe-af72-11e3-9ac4-3ffe93523c3e.png)
-  Tab
  -  Before: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2461189/6e0b44ca-af74-11e3-8f77-5a3db21c7dcc.png)
  -  After: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2461183/56305ce6-af74-11e3-985a-ddc437efae2a.png)

I still have to figure out how to write the specs for this, though...

data.title: devtools open after opening atom on windows, blank atom main window
data.body:
After opening atom the developer tools window opens but the Atom main window remains blank. Build on master, commit 0d190d2cd4.

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616991/18561930/23173a82-7b82-11e6-9dba-1862cd05c329.png)
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616991/18561936/28097eba-7b82-11e6-9b78-902f20bb5deb.png)

"Uncaught Error: spawn ENOENT" Atom on 64-bit Ubuntu
data.body:
![atomerror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/576955/2923465/7e82f6b6-d717-11e3-8782-080b6b0eda1d.png)

A new error occurs every second. Whenever I close the console or attempt to look into the lines where the error is "coming from," the console immediately reopens to this view. The console can't be closed without it reopening again. This didn't happen before I installed non-default packages; I haven't narrowed it done to which one caused this (if it is caused by a package).

Packages Installed:
Archive View
Atom Beautifier
Atom Dark Syntax
Atom Django
Atom HTML Preview

Fizzy
HTML Hint

Pretty JSON
Rails Rspec
Sort Lines

Visual Bell

Atom installed by following the guidelines here:
http://www.webupd8.org/2014/05/install-atom-text-editor-in-ubuntu-via-ppa.html

data.title: Uncaught InvalidCharacterError: The string contains invalid characters.

While using parser HTML (Ruby-ERB), every time I try to close an ERB tag using `%>` I get an JS Exception like this.

![atom_erb_exception](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/27406/2922759/c354802c-d706-11e3-9da1-344d9d25dd08.png)

Looks like directly involving Atom, but maybe it involves the ERB syntax parser.

Any clue?

data.title: Running specs, Ubuntu 14.04.
data.body:
right now, 'Run Atom Specs'(`ctrl-alt-s`) runs all specs, 'Run Package Spec'(`ctrl-alt-p`) runs Atom specs :persevere:

Anyway, I have 5 failures. Is it normal? 

```
✗ uname -vsom
Linux #47-Ubuntu SMP Fri May 2 23:30:00 UTC 2014 x86_64 GNU/Linux
✗ node -v     
v0.10.25
✗ npm -v      
1.4.10
✗ atom -v
38bd996
```

failing specs:

```
the `atom` global
package lifecycle methods
.deactivatePackage(id)
atom packages
it removes the package's keymaps
TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'webkitMatchesSelector'
TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'webkitMatchesSelector'
at /home/dmitry/github/atom/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:229:28
at Array.filter (native)
at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.findKeyBindings (/home/dmitry/github/atom/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:228:48)
at atom-spec.coffee:383:33
.isReleasedVersion()
it returns false if the version is a SHA and true otherwise
Error: Leaking subscriptions for paths: /home/dmitry/.atom/styles.less
Error: Leaking subscriptions for paths: /home/dmitry/.atom/styles.less
at ensureNoPathSubscriptions (/home/dmitry/github/atom/spec/spec-helper.coffee:139:15)
at spec-helper.coffee:130:3
EditorView
font family

it updates the font family of editors and recalculates dimensions critical to cursor positioning
Expected { top : 100, left : 24 } to equal { top : 100, left : 48 }.
at editor-view-spec.coffee:367:55
when setInvisibles is toggled (regression)
it correctly calculates the position left for non-monospaced invisibles

PaneView
when an unmodifed buffer's path is deleted
it removes the pane item

data.title: ctrl+click to add a cursor doesn't work on linux
data.body: `cmd`+`click` works to add a cursor on mac, but `ctrl`+`click` doesn't work on linux. Also there's no listing in the keyboard shortcuts section of settings, otherwise I would have just added it to my `keymap.cson`.

data.title: Added install and uninstall scripts for easier upgrade
data.body: Added install and uninstall scripts for easier upgrade and improved `README.md`.

data.title: Linux: Change alt-keys to ctrl-keys (e.g. alt-left)
data.body:
I want to have the alt key switched with the ctrl key for some native commands like "move to beginning of word" because on KDE/Linux I'm used to navigate with ctrl+left (or ctrl-shift-left to select the whole word from the cursor).
Is there an easy way to change the native commands quickly? Or do I have to insert them in my keymap.cson file. 
If so, how? Cause this doesn't work:

'.editor':
  'ctrl-left': 'editor:move-to-beginning-of-word'

Atom 61cdee9, Fedora 20 64bit

data.title: Weird rendering issue in MD preview
data.body:
Adding and removing a space here changes the style of the following fenced code.

![8nxm3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2743004/2921361/712424c4-d6f2-11e3-88cc-c693a4caf6d6.gif)

Using this markdown (I had to escape the fenced codes somehow):

``````
### Linux Requirements
  * Ubuntu LTS 12.04 64-bit is the recommended platform
  * OS with 64-bit architecture
  * [node.js](http://nodejs.org/download/) v0.10.x
  * [npm](http://www.npmjs.org/) v1.4.x
  * `sudo apt-get install libgnome-keyring-dev`
  * `npm config set python /usr/bin/python2 -g` to ensure that gyp uses Python 2

  \```sh
  git clone https://github.com/atom/atom
  cd atom
  script/build # Creates application at /tmp/atom-build/Atom
  sudo script/grunt install # Installs command to /usr/local/bin/atom
  \```

  Last step can be replaced with the following command to get a `.deb` package

  \```
  script/grunt mkdeb # Generates a .deb package at /tmp/atom-build
  \```

#### Debian based OS
  * <-- ADD AND REMOVE SPACE HERE
  \```sh
  git clone https://github.com/atom/atom
  cd atom
  sudo script/deb/install
  \```
``````

data.title: Windows launch JavaScript error
data.body:
After a successful build, launching Atom produces the following error:

```
Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 13, got 11.
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:311:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:362:17)
    at require (module.js:379:17)
    at bindings (PATH-TO-ATOM\resources\app\node_modules\nslog\node_modules\bindings\bindings.js:76:44)
    at Object.<anonymous> (PATH-TO-ATOM\resources\app\node_modules\nslog\lib\nslog.js:4:30)
...
```

Tell me if you need more of the output; I can't copy and paste it from the dialog. The rest of the trace is from `module.js` and `nslog.js`.

I can't seem to find a solution, even after deleting the `node_modules` folder and calling `npm update` as suggested by posts on StackOverflow.

Any ideas? Thanks!

data.title: Cannot use CTRL+BACKSPACE to remove the word behind the cursor
"Editor is not responding" message
data.body:
> The editor is not responding. Would you like to force close it or just keep waiting?

This is the message I keep getting sometimes when I try and close tabs or windows. Specifically, when I try to close a window that has the settings tab opened.
